column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation works with Women's Community Shelters (WCS) to support one of Australia's most marginalised and at-risk groups: women on temporary visas who are homeless after fleeing violence. The Foundation has supported WCS for three years and, in that time, it has helped 103 women and 77 children, providing shelter, case management and financial assistance for women and their children to stay in crisis and transitional accommodation.
column20: Women's Community Shelters, temporary visa, financial assistance

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In the US, the Goodman Foundation has supported the work of the Friends and Helpers Foundation for over six years. It provides essentials for women and children who have fled domestic violence. Each year, Goodman volunteers its premises and people and their families for a day of packing school supplies into backpacks so children are happy and prepared for their first day back at school.
column20: Friends and Helpers Foundation, woman, child, domestic violence

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Raise Foundation's mentoring program in high schools is good for both the mentees and the trusted mentors who show up for them. Raise aspires to deliver its community-building programs across Australia, prioritising younger public secondary school students at the most risk of disengagement or poor well-being. Its effectiveness is why the Goodman Foundation is a long-term partner of the Raise Foundation.
column20: Raise Foundation, mentoring program, community-building program

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: A lack of suitable rest areas in quality and quantity contributes to risk factors for truck drivers. The not-for-profit Healthy Heads Trucks and Sheds (HHTS) works to alleviate mental health and well-being challenges in its field. The Goodman Foundation has helped HHTS since 2021 to research the establishment of 'gold standard' rest areas for truck drivers. It is hoped that better and more rest areas may reduce the risk factors for workers in the industry.
column20: Healthy Heads Trucks and Sheds, rest area, truck driver

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation partnered with Cerebral Palsy Australia on a program to ensure babies at risk of Cerebral Palsy receive vital early identification, treatment and support. The program helps families access 30 hours of critical therapy for their baby and support for the whole family's well-being. Over the last three years, it has supported at least 50 babies and provided more than 1,000 hours of intensive therapy.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: AdifÃÂºn Foundation exists to improve the autonomy of Spanish people with a broad range of special needs. It helps finance rehabilitation and subsidise the cost of the orthopaedic aids and house adaptations that can hugely improve a person's daily life - yet can be very expensive. Goodman's donation covered the purchase of orthopaedic aids for four children, including walking frames, sitters and highly specialised chairs.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In Australia, the Goodman Foundation's seed funding helped to launch Refettorio OzHarvest in inner-city Sydney. Through this initiative, those experiencing food insecurity can enjoy a warm and nourishing meal. The project collaborates with renowned chef Massimo Bottura and is part of a global project showing a zero-waste philosophy and feeding those in need with dignity and respect. Refettorio OzHarvest has hosted high-profile chef events, fundraisers and neighbourhood dinners, enabling the public to eat in the beautiful restaurant, too, with all funds going back to OzHarvest's work feeding those referred by around 80 local charities.
column20: Refettorio OzHarvest, food insecurity, nourishing meal

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation supported UKHarvest's community food hubs. The hubs supported around 50,000 people. While good food items, nutrition education and service referrals are present, many come mainly for companionship in a warm roomÃ¢ÂÂ when household heating costs are high. Goodman's funds are helping to create more community hubs in the UK, with an expansion to areas with a combined population of 30 million.
column20: UKHarvest, community food hub, nutrition education

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Goodman's food relief work in the United States has ramped up to meet growing demand. The Goodman Foundation's donation is fuelling Feeding America's trucks to keep delivering to 83,000 households a month in a part of the State with more than 800,000 residents living below the poverty line.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation's donation to Second Harvest funded an electric van to transport volunteers safely to the warehouse. Meanwhile, the donation to Meals on Wheels will fund a charging station for its electric delivery refrigerator trucks to keep bringing nutritious meals to over 12,000 isolated seniors, providing daily human contact and helping prevent premature institutionalisation.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Nutritious food is rare and costly in remote First Nations communities across Australia. The processed food that is readily available can lead to health issues such as type two diabetes, renal disease and hypertension. Enter Meals for the Mob, a program run by FareShare, with the help of First Nations volunteers. FareShare runs Australia's largest charity kitchens in Brisbane and Melbourne, cooking over 10,000 meals for frontline charities daily.
column20: Meals for the Mob, nutritious food, FareShare

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: A longstanding partner of the Goodman Foundation, the Little Olive Child Foundation helps families still experiencing the impact of the Fukushima nuclear incident 2011. After several years of supporting Little Olive's work in providing safe indoor play centres, the Foundation began supporting a 'Farmer's Food Box' initiative for families in Fukushima, Kumamoto and Hiroshima prefectures. These prefectures have over 1,000 children under 12 who need fresh and healthy food. The boxes ensured their families had vegetables, eggs and rice to alleviate their financial pressures and provided much-needed support to local farmers.
column20: Little Olive Child Foundation, Fukushima nuclear incident, Farmer's Food Box

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The longstanding Hong Kong SAR charity run, the Goodman Magic Mile, broke records this year by raising HK$2.5m for Habitat for Humanity, 2.5 times the HK$1 million target. All funds went to Habitat for Humanity's work to improve the living conditions of vulnerable Hong Kong SAR residents. The money raised this year was able to help 550 vulnerable households, providing home-improving services to 250 homes and winter care kits for 300 older people, including blankets, heaters and electric kettles.
column20: Goodman Magic Mile, Habitat for Humanity, household

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In October 2022, Stepping Stone House held its annual Sleep Under the Stars fundraising event at Sydney's Taronga Zoo to raise money for shelter, care and support for homeless and disadvantaged young people. Several Goodman people participated virtually or at the zoo.
column20: Sleep Under the Stars, Taronga Zoo, homelessness

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Joyful and memorable childhood holidays are a wonderful thing to carry into adulthood. In the US, the Goodman Foundation supports Hope in a Suitcase to make this happen for children in foster care. Goodman's US team volunteers in the charity's quarterly events such as 'Bring the Holidays Home' where current and former foster care youth, sometimes with their children, receive new toiletries, clothes, books, backpacks, school supplies, shoes and winter coats, as well as toys and holiday gifts.
column20: Hope in a Suitcase, foster care, Bring the Holidays Home

Political contributions
Political contributions
column13: Goodman has a Political Donations Policy that prohibits making donations for the benefit of political parties, an elected member, a candidate or groups of candidates, or a person or entity who may use the donation to make a political donation. Goodman will also not contribute funds for membership or affiliation to political parties. This policy supports business integrity and reduces the risk of corruption.
column20: Political Donations Policy, political party, business integrity
